definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout
second-eldest child in a family/(euphemism) penis
eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
old age/very/eldest child in a family/leader of a group/boss/captain of a boat/leader of a criminal gang
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
younger male cousin via female line
son of grandfather's sister/son of grandmother's brother or sister/father's younger male cousin/(Hong Kong slang) mainlander
older male cousin via female line
